1{-# LANGUAGE ViewPatterns #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
3{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
4
5-- | Bracket type.
6
7module Koshucode.Baala.Base.Code.Bracket
8  ( -- * Bracket
9    Bracket (..),
10    GetBracket,
11    bracketTable,
12
13    -- * Indent
14    indentBranch,
15  ) where
16
17import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture              as O
18import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Abort            as B
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.List             as B
20import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Code.Message     as Msg
21
22
23-- ============================================  Bracket
24
25-- | Bracket type.
26data Bracket b
27    = BracketNone       -- ^ None bracket
28    | BracketOpen  b    -- ^ Open bracket
29    | BracketClose b    -- ^ Close bracket
30      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
31
32-- ----------------------  Bracket table
33
34-- | Get a bracket type.
35type GetBracket b a = a -> Bracket b
36
37-- | Create 'GetBracket' functions
38-- from a type-open-close table.
39--
40-- /Example/
41--
42-- Create bracket/type functions from @()@ and @[]@.
43--
44--   >>> let bracket n [a, b] = (n, ((== a), (== b)))
45--   >>> let pt = bracketTable [ bracket 1 "()", bracket 2 "[]" ]
46--
47-- Get bracket types for each chars.
48-- Types of open brackets are positive integer,
49-- and closes are negative.
50--
51--   >>> map pt "ab(cd[ef])g"
52--   [BracketNone, BracketNone,
53--    BracketOpen 1, BracketNone, BracketNone,
54--     BracketOpen 2, BracketNone, BracketNone, BracketClose 2,
55--    BracketClose 1, BracketNone]
56--
57bracketTable
58    :: (Eq a)
59    => [(b, (O.Test a, O.Test a))] -- ^ List of (/type/, (/open/, /close/))
60    -> GetBracket b a
61bracketTable xs = bracketType where
62    bracketTypeTable = map bracketOpen xs ++ map bracketClose xs
63    bracketOpen  (n, (isOpen, _))  = (isOpen,  BracketOpen n)
64    bracketClose (n, (_, isClose)) = (isClose, BracketClose n)
65    bracketType a =
66        case B.lookupSatisfy a bracketTypeTable of
67          Just p  -> p
68          Nothing -> BracketNone
69
70
71-- ============================================  Indent
72
73-- | Indent branching function.
74--   This inserts open\/separator\/close elements by following indent.
75--
76--   >>> let size s = if dropWhile (== '/') s == "" then Just (length s) else Nothing
77--   >>> let test s = s `elem` [">", "-"]
78--   >>> let toks s = takeWhile (== '/') s : words (dropWhile (== '/') s)
79--   >>> let text = Right . unwords . concat
80--   >>> let conv ls = text =<< indentBranch size test "(" "|" ")" (toks <$> ls)
81--
82--   >>> toks "/> bb"
83--   ["/",">","bb"]
84--
85--   >>> conv ["> aa", "/> bb", "//> cc"]
86--   Right "> aa ( > bb ( > cc ) )"
87--
88--   >>> conv ["> aa", "/> bb", "/> cc"]
89--   Right "> aa ( > bb | > cc )"
90--
91--   >>> conv ["> aa", "/> bb", "//- cc", "///cc", "//- dd", "//- ee", "/- ff"]
92--   Right "> aa ( > bb ( - cc cc | - dd | - ee ) | - ff )"
93--
94indentBranch
95    :: (a -> Maybe Int)  -- ^ Function getting indent size
96    -> O.Test a          -- ^ Testing indent element
97    -> a                 -- ^ Open element
98    -> a                 -- ^ Separator element
99    -> a                 -- ^ Close element
100    -> [[a]]             -- ^ Code elements indented
101    -> B.Ab [[a]]        -- ^ Code Elements with open\/separator\/close elements
102indentBranch size indent open sep close = line [0] where
103    line iis@(i:_) (((size -> Just i') : xs@(k:_)) : ls)
104         | not $ indent k = next iis                 xs  ls
105         | i' == 0        = next iis                 xs  ls
106         | i' == i        = next iis        (sep   : xs) ls
107         | i' >  i        = next (i' : iis) (open  : xs) ls
108         | i' <  i        = unindent i' iis (sep : xs) ls
109    line is (xs : ls)  = next is xs ls
110    line [0] []        = Right []
111    line is  []        = Right [replicate (length is  - 1) close]
112
113    unindent _ [] _ _ = Msg.extraCloseBracketInserted
114    unindent i' iis@(i:is) xs ls
115        | i' < i      = unindent i' is (close : xs) ls
116        | i  < i'     = Msg.unmatchIndentSize
117        | otherwise   = next iis xs ls
118
119    next is' xs' ls   = do ls' <- line is' ls
120                           Right $ xs' : ls'
